Descriptions: Country
State
County or municipality (if in Puerto Rico)
NEON domain name
Unique identifier of the NEON domain
Full site name
Four letter site code
NEON plot type in which sampling occurred: tower, distributed or gradient
Further.Documentation: For more information, see NEON.DOC.000913 'TOS Science Design for Spatial Sampling' for an overview of the terrestrial observation system sampling strategies

Descriptions: Type of plot or grid associated with a plot type: basePlot, mammalGrid, birdGrid, tickPlot, mosquitoPoint, phenology
Further.Documentation: For more information, see NEON.DOC.000913 'TOS Science Design for Spatial Sampling' for an overview of the implementation of the study design

Descriptions: Subtype specification
Comments: Subtype specification is there to further differentiate between multiple possible sampling methods employed within a single plot subtype. See subtype specific section of science design document to understand purpose of subtype specifications when they exist
Further.Documentation: For more information, see NEON.DOC.000913 'TOS Science Design for Spatial Sampling' for an overview of the implementation of the study design

Descriptions: Plot identifier (NEON site code_XXX)
Comments: Plot IDs are used as the unique identifier for data products downloaded from the portal

Descriptions: plot area (m). Note: Tick plots at GUAN are an alternative shape to the standard 40m by 40m square transect.
Dimensions of plot (m). Note: Tick plots at GUAN are an alternative shape to the standard 40m by 40m square transect.
Relative coordinate of the point within the given plotID
Comments: All points are labeled according to a standardized grid system, even when just a single point
Further.Documentation: For more information, see NEON.DOC.001025 'TOS Protocol and Procedure: Plot Establishment' or NEON.DOC.000913 'TOS Science Design for Spatial Sampling'

Descriptions: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, WGS84)
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, WGS84)
Model used to measure horizontal position on the earth
UTM zone
Geographic coordinate specifying the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface (Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM))
Geographic coordinate specifying the north-south position of a point on the Earth's surface (Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM))
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given spatial location describing the smallest circle containing the actual location. Zero is not a valid value for this term unless determined by GIS
Elevation (in meters) above mean sea level

The vertical distance (in meters) from the given elevation describing the maximum range (plus or minus) containing the actual elevation. Zero is not a valid value for this term unless determined by GIS
Minimum elevation of the plot (m)
Maximum elevation of the plot (m)
Maximum slope gradient (degrees) within the plot
Slope aspect (degrees) of the maximum slope gradient within the plot
National Land Cover Database classification from the initial year of sampling
Comments: Tower Plots enable observations that can be integrated with tower-based sensors to calibrate and parameterize insight into ecological processes. Tower Plots are placed randomly in proximity to the NEON tower. The sample location of these plots are not generated according to the stratified design and should not be integrated with Distributed Plots in the context of design-based inference. The NLCD cover class attributed to Tower Base Plots was determined in situ during plot establishment and does not reflect remotely sensed NLCD data provided by the MRLC and USGS
Further.Documentation: For more information, see NEON.DOC.000913 'TOS Science Design for Spatial Sampling'. More information about the NLCD itself can be found at 'http://www.mrlc.gov/'

Descriptions: Soil order type
Comments: Soil orders are derived from the USDA NRCS soil survey

Descriptions: The method used to collect or create spatial information
Comments: GeoXH 6000 and Geo 7X are both models of Trimble handheld GPS recievers

Descriptions: Date of GPS field collection
Number of filtered positions taken when collecting GPS data
position dilution of precision for GPS data
Horizontal dilution of precision for GPS data

Pipe-delimited list of modules sampled at the plot: BET = beetles; BGC = biogeochemistry; BRD = birds; CWD = coarse woody debris; DHP = digital hemispherical photos for leaf area index; DIV = plant diversity; HBP = herbaceous productivity; LBS = camera-quadrat for leaf area index by species; LTR = litter and fine woody debris; MAM = mammal abundance and diversity; MFB = mat-forming bryophyte production; MOS = mosquitoes; MPT = mosquito pathogens; PHE = plant phenology; SME = soil microbes; SLS = soil sampling; TCK = ticks; VST = vegetation structure
Comments: To download data for these modules, visit http://data.neonscience.org/data-product-catalog.
Further.Documentation: See the 'TOS SCIENCE DESIGN FOR SPATIAL SAMPLING' (NEON.DOC.000913) for further details regarding which science design document fully articulates each module. See also specific sampling science designs for more information (NEON.DOC.001024 TOS Protocol and Procedure Canopy Foliage Chemistry and Leaf Mass Per Area Measurements, 	NEON.DOC.001100 TOS Protocol and Procedure Ground Beetle and Mosquito Specimen Processing, 	NEON.DOC.014041 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Breeding Landbird Abundance and Diversity, 	NEON.DOC.001709 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Bryophyte Productivity, 	NEON.DOC.001711 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Coarse Downed Wood, 	NEON.DOC.014038 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Core Sampling for Plant Belowground Biomass, 	NEON.DOC.014050 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Ground Beetle Sampling, 	NEON.DOC.001710 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Litterfall and Fine Woody Debris, 	NEON.DOC.001271 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Manual Data Transcription, 	NEON.DOC.014037 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Measurement of Herbaceous Biomass, 	NEON.DOC.014039 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Measurement of Leaf Area Index, 	NEON.DOC.000987 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Measurement of Vegetation Structure, 	NEON.DOC.014049 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Mosquito Sampling, 	NEON.DOC.014042 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Plant Diversity Sampling, 	NEON.DOC.014040 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Plant Phenology, 	NEON.DOC.000481 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Small Mammal Sampling, 	NEON.DOC.014048 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Soil Physical, Chemical, and Microbial Measurements, 	NEON.DOC.014045 TOS Protocol and Procedure: Tick and Tick-Borne Pathogen Sampling)

Descriptions: Length of one edge of the plot square (m)
